Author: burbank#1598
Content: I hate to reveal what a newbie I am but I assume it would be a good thing to increase ARRR profile. For example would it be strange to make an inquiry to Coinomi about why I can't add Pirate to my Coinomi wallet. I am enjoying mining on the piratepool.io but it struck me how hard it is to find any info on this coin because the keyword pirate just swamps results with sailing pirates. Heh. I am just fascinated with the chatter about this coin as for other coins there is a sense of complete disconnectedness.

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Right now, pirate is desktop only due to the need of running a full node and having adequate hardware to do z transactions .  When sapling and mobile upgrades happen in Zcash I'm sure they will be merged into pirate

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content:
Coinomi does not have full zaddr support that I am aware of but I will reach out to their team to ensure that.   
The problem mainly lies in the difficult processing power for the z transactions.

Author: LocoMB#8593
Content:
here is a thought on the Exchange question with ARRR:
as I understand, because of z-add only, DEX is not possible- so how about someone write a CC where an agreed upon exchange is pushed through in small batches?
tedious and forbidding manually, but then if there is smart contract to incrementally exchange 10, 100, or 1000 batches, then the counterparty risk would be limited to one batch only ... old concept ofc, but unfeasible w/o smart contracts- but for ARRR this could be an important ingredient
